function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Possible higher COVID-19 prevalence in the community than reported through clinical surveillance.","Impact":"Risk of undetected or unreported cases leading to increased transmission and outbreak.","Mitigation":"Increase the scope of clinical testing and surveillance to capture mild or asymptomatic cases.","Technologies":"Advanced testing methods for detecting mild or asymptomatic cases, serological surveys for population-based infection estimates.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, individuals with mild or no symptoms.","Owner":"Health authorities, government health agencies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Complexity of estimating COVID-19 prevalence based on SARS-CoV-2 RNA concentrations in sewage.","Impact":"Difficulty in accurately gauging the actual prevalence of the virus in the population, leading to challenges in early detection and intervention.","Mitigation":"Combine sewage data with other surveillance methods, improve testing policies, and refine data interpretation techniques.","Technologies":"Integration of sewage data with clinical testing, development of advanced data analysis algorithms, improvement in testing policy.","People":"Researchers, public health experts, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, government health departments."},{"Description":"Sewage data serving as a sensitive tool for early warning of increasing virus circulation in the population.","Impact":"Potential to use sewage data as an early warning system for rising virus circulation, enabling proactive intervention.","Mitigation":"Establish and integrate sewage monitoring systems with public health surveillance networks, develop protocols for timely response to sewage data signals.","Technologies":"Sewage monitoring systems, real-time data analytics, integration with public health surveillance systems.","People":"Public health officials, government agencies, researchers.","Owner":"Government health departments, research institutions, public health authorities."}]}
